input_text: The European Union approved new regulations for AI systems today, requiring transparency and human oversight for high-risk applications. The AI Act will take effect in 2026, giving companies two years to comply. Violations could result in fines up to 6% of global revenue. Privacy advocates praised the move while tech companies expressed concerns about implementation costs.

expected_output.summary: EU approved AI Act requiring transparency for high-risk systems, effective 2026 with penalties up to 6% of revenue.
